data.title: Don't just browse live and historical walks in East Williston, New York, US. Be a part of history and livestream your walks too!
data.meta_description: Don't just browse live and historical walks in East Williston, New York, US. Be a part of history and livestream your walks too!
data.text:
This two-hour walking tour of East Williston, New York, United States, will take you through the charming streets of this quaint village.

Start your tour at the East Williston Train Station (Address: 2 Railroad Ave, East Williston, NY 11596; Latitude/Longitude: 40.764862, -73.595045). From here, you can take a leisurely stroll down Railroad Avenue, admiring the historic homes and buildings that line the street.

Continue your tour by heading south on Hillside Avenue. Here, you can find a variety of interesting shops and restaurants, including the popular East Williston Deli (Address: 2 Hillside Ave, East Williston, NY 11596; Latitude/Longitude: 40.765045, -73.595045).

Next, make your way to the East Williston Village Green (Address: 1 Village Green, East Williston, NY 11596; Latitude/Longitude: 40.764862, -73.595045). This picturesque park is a great place to take a break and enjoy the scenery.

Continue your tour by heading east on Hillside Avenue. Here, you can find a variety of interesting shops and restaurants, including the popular East Williston Bakery (Address: 4 Hillside Ave, East Williston, NY 11596; Latitude/Longitude: 40.764862, -73.595045).

Next, make your way to the East Williston Library (Address: 5 Hillside Ave, East Williston, NY 11596; Latitude/Longitude: 40.764862, -73.595045). This historic building is a great place to take a break and explore the library's collection of books and other materials.

Continue your tour by heading north on Hillside Avenue. Here, you can find a variety of interesting shops and restaurants, including the popular East Williston Pizza (Address: 6 Hillside Ave, East Williston, NY 11596; Latitude/Longitude: 40.764862, -73.595045).

Finally, make your way to the East Williston Post Office (Address: 7 Hillside Ave, East Williston, NY 11596; Latitude/Longitude: 40.764862, -73.595045). This historic building is a great place to take a break and explore the post office's collection of stamps and other materials.

At the end of your tour, you can take a leisurely stroll back to the East Williston Train Station, where your tour began.

Babylon Tours New York City

Babylon Tours Top-rated Private & Semi-Private tours of the world’s greatest museums and city walking tours. The yellow taxis, the soaring skyscrapers, the street-side hot dog vendors – you think you know New York City already, right? We are not so sure. Our English-speaking local guides know the city inside out and can share the stories behind the landmarks you have a ... More lready seen on TV. Whether it is a historical overview of the colonial days in Lower Manhattan or a cultural romp through the 19th-century marvel, Central Park, our tours go beyond the clichés. We will delight you with fun yet informative stories to make New York come alive. Take a bite out of the Big Apple with Babylon Tours and see how good it tastes.
